reviews.text: I stayed there for only a night. They were nice to upgrade me to Gold service. The Gold lounge was great, with free coffee, tea, alcholic drinks, light refershments, etc. and there is a computer and a board room for use. Dave, the manager, game me a warm welcome and gave me a tour of the lounge. Great so far but...
reviews.title: Great hotel but no hot water.....

reviews.text: There is no hot water in my room. I have to trun the tap on for over 15 minutes and the water then is a little warm. The sent an engineer to check it and admit they were having a problem. I was totally suprised that they did not offer to change room for me. I can't imagine the hotel being full in April.
reviews.title: Reliably Fairmont

reviews.text: Before you book this hotel, call and make sure they have hot water.....
reviews.title: Passing through Winnipeg with my...

reviews.text: This hotel is nothing pretty to look at, with a typically 70s concrete design. Inside, the interior is generally quite nice although the public restrooms could use an upgrade. I had a nice Fairmont Gold room with a large bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
I'd stay here again, why not
reviews.text: Passing through Winnipeg with my girlfriend on a business trip, I wanted to take her somewhere nice ecause we were going to be there for her birthday. I didn't have the budget for The Mariaggi, which sounds amazing. I picked The Fairmont over the Fort Garry because The Fairmont listed a salt water pool, hot tub and steam room, and Fort Garry's spa is only accessible with treatment purchases.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wedding party stayed at the Fairmont the night before my wedding. My husband and I also stayed for our wedding night.
reviews.title: Unbelievable service - way over and above!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The night before the wedding, me and the wedding party stayed in one of the suites and had an awesome time! The room was lovely. We ordered room service, watched TV and hung out in the pool and hot tub. The service was great, and the pool area was lovely. We had it all to ourselves, and as it's on the 19th floor of the hotel had an incredible evening view!
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding night stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day of my wedding, my flowers arrived about an hour and a half before we were to leave for the ceremony - and they were all wrong! The bouquets were put together wrong, and the boutonnieres were the wrong size! Incredibly, the restaurant manager is also an incredible florist! On a busy Saturday morning he spent over an hour in our hotel room re-cutting, re-arranging and re-tying our bouquets. He also called a local flower wholesaler and arranged for the correct size of flowers for the boutonnieres to be delivered to us by taxi! Once they arrived, he actually made the bouts for us - floral tape, pins and all. I've never, ever seen service like it!
reviews.title: Horrible- would not recommed!

reviews.text: When my husband and I arrived after the wedding, we were surprised with rose petals scattered around the room, nice music playing and chocolate-dipped strawberries. Breakfast in the Fairmont Gold lounge was awesome - chocolat croissants are VERY good!
reviews.title: Fairmont Gold: Good Service, Decent Food, Poor Amenities

reviews.text: Overall, it was hands-down the most incredible service we've ever received! Totally recommend it.
reviews.title: Older Run Down Property -- Stay Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a two night stay at this hotel prior to our polar bear trip to Churchill. We decided to fly into Toronto from the uk and then straight on to Winnipeg on the same day so that we had a full day and a half to see the city and so we didn't arrive at the hotel until 8 p.m. or so
reviews.title: Fairmont Winnipeg Fits The Bill

reviews.text: Our room was a king suite which was a little dated but still comfortable and clean
reviews.title: A good hotel

reviews.text: A notable point was the plumbing - we had checked this hotel on trip advisor before booking and thought that previous reviewers' comments were quite comical - we thought that the hotel were carrying out some renovation works but it was just the noise of the hotel pipes for the duration of the toilet being flushed. It wasn't a problem - we found it quite amusing and this added to the "charm" of the hotel
reviews.title: hated the Fairmont Winnipeg

reviews.text: The hotel bar and the food served in the bar were very good and reasonably priced
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay- Worth the extra money
a fairmont weekend
reviews.text: The title says it all really. Nothing to complain about. I did have a mattress that was too soft and it was change instantly.

As we are members of Fairmont Presidents Club we used a suite upgrade.The suite was large but shabby and had no opening windows. We moved the next day to a very bright Fairmont room with opening windows and our suite credit went to our next reservation in Banff.
reviews.title: The most incredible staff

likes.disliked: — rooms with windows that didn't open

reviews.text: The maid service, room service,valet/porter/concierge ( all one great well informed person),front desk,bar service, restaurant service were all EXCELLENT There were always helpful doormen in attendance.
reviews.title: Needs a makeover

reviews.text: Food was great in the bar and in the Velvet Glove ( breakfast).
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you value hot water, a decent night's sleep & value for money

likes.disliked: — The price, the dodgy water pipes (lack of hot water, very noisy)

reviews.title: Service is wonderful
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is as good as anywhere else, in the interesting Exchange District.
Upon departure my husband left an item which was fedexed the next day.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel

reviews.text: I want so much to like this hotel - brand name alone is one of the reasons. This hotel is in so much need of an update though it's almost sad, and to be honest - I'm surprised Fairmont hasn't stepped in long ago.
reviews.title: Old and outdated, but there are some positive points..
Hard to Believe its Part of the "Fairmont" chain
reviews.text: The lobby of the Fairmont is nice, and fairly modern. There are comfy seating areas and a business centre (internet is also available in the room for a cost) and both the restaurant and lounge are also located here. The elevators at this hotel are very fast and you never wait long to get in one. Even when you get off the elevator, the carpet in the hallways appears modern. And then you get in the room...

Put blankly, these rooms are outdated. Not even mildly outdated - brutally outdated. I'm not sure when the last time they were refurbished but it can't have been within the past 15 years. The beds are hard and old, the bathrooms dark and television one of the smallest I've seen. The drapes don't close very well so light is always shining through and I've had problems with the heating/cooling system many times. Are there positive points? Yes. The selection of Fairmont Tea is a nice touch. The rooms are generally large and I enjoy the bath products they stock, however everything you read on here is true - they need to be renovated.
reviews.title: One sentence? Here it is: 200 dollars to sleep for a night in a mouldy room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Short of that (and really, what is more important than the rooms?), the hotel has some great qualities. I love the fitness centre and pool area. Both are located on the highest floor and have sweeping views on the city. The fitness centre has quite a few cardio and weight machines and is generally well regulated with temperature, however I have been up there in the height of summer and found it stuffy. The pool is nice and long in length, with a hot tub located beside it and a wonderful steam room with hints of eucalyptus.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing - not Fairmont standard at all! Nov 2009

reviews.text: Also, the lounge and restaurant are reportedly reknowned for their food. I have eaten in the lounge many times (never the restaurant) and the food is excellent. It's mildly on the pricey side but most hotels tend to do that anyways and you are dining at the Fairmont. Nonetheless, the prices aren't horrifying - especially when you see how good the food is.
reviews.title: Warm Hospitality during a cold spell

reviews.text: All the staff I encountered at the Fairmont were very pleasant and obliging. Connection to the Main underground arcade means most downtown offices can be reached without facing Winnipeg's cold. Although the lobby and public areas are quite swish, the rooms are a real letdown. Even the vigilant housekeeping service cannot make up for the 80's decor. Think lots of brass and pastels. The bathrooms are particularly dated. The TV in my room was tiny and the cable reception was very poor. Many channels did not work at all and those that did were very fuzzy. The internet service was also problematic. In spite of the hotel's exemplary staff, I will be looking for alternatives next time I visit Winnipeg.
reviews.title: 4-star service, 2-star rooms

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend while taking part in a conference focusing on improving marriage so we were hoping for a romantic getaway. Unfortunately I found myself distracted by several issues that made me wish we had stayed somewhere else.
reviews.title: Not on par with the Fairmont reputation

reviews.text: #1) You have to pay $15 a day for internet and wifi is only available in the lobby
reviews.title: Nice staff, outdated rooms

reviews.text: #2) You have to pay $1.70 per phone call
reviews.title: Hands down the best experience I have ever had.

reviews.text: #3) The conference room we were using showed some heavy wear and tear and the sound quality was lacking
reviews.title: Outdated hotel with poorly trained staff

reviews.text: Can't really find too much wrong with the Fairmont Winnipeg - nice location within walking distance of the Exchange District, the Forks, and St. Boniface (across the river). I was here for a conference so got an good rate on the room - $130.
reviews.title: Fair stay at Fairmont Winnipeg

reviews.text: The room was fairly standard (see pics). I was surprised at the quality of the carpets as they looked well used and in need of updating. The light fixtures in the room proved problematic as the switches were a little stiff and hard to operate. Bathroom well appointed with all the extras plus two terrycloth robes (nice touch). Room had an ironing board and iron.
reviews.title: Great staff. Loved the pool&fitness. Rooms are dull.

likes.disliked: — Only some of Fairmont's standards are met

reviews.text: Was able to visit the Gold Floor during my stay on an orientation tour and it was quite nice - might be worth looking into the additional cost of staying at that "level" if comfort and extras are your thing.
reviews.title: OK hotel with great staff but not worth the price

likes.disliked: — dated rooms and not upto usual Fairmont standard

reviews.text: Service was excellent and there is free internet available in room and in the lobby if you don't have a laptop. Booking was easy and straightforward.
reviews.title: A good place to stay

likes.disliked: — Small TV channel selection (I like to watch after a day with my clients!)

reviews.text: Overall, if I was back in Winnipeg I'd probably stay at the Fairmont if I could get a good rate. I might try the Fort Garry though for a more "historic" stay (plus it's apparently haunted).
reviews.title: Wonerful stay

reviews.text: I wanted to like this hotel but it didn't live up to the Fairmount name. The service is fine but the hotel is old and this does affect the quality of the stay. Just some minor notes: The shower makes a high pitched noise from the hot water which is really annoying and makes you want to rush, the drapes just cover the windows and don't completely black out the light, the TV is old but works fine, there is no conceirge so you have to ask reception which is strange and I didn't receive a print out under my door for checkout.
reviews.title: Not great..average stay.

reviews.text: Again, none of these things on their own are that big a deal but they did affect my stay from being great. I think it would be fine for a night but I may try elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Treated my 1-year old like royalty
Nothing that stood out
reviews.text: Stayed over the long weekend, just me and my son, while visiting family. Bellman, room service and Velvet Glove staff were incredible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were ok and comfortable, but it was the serice that stood out.
reviews.title: Like a best western

reviews.text: Food: room service was better than most hotels at this range, and only had breakfast in the Velvet Glove, but it was great.
reviews.title: Run Down Room

likes.liked: — The proximity to the mellenium center.
